medications.name: Metformin
medications.indication: Type 2 diabetes mellitus, Polycystic ovary syndrome (off-label)
medications.mechanism: Decreases hepatic glucose production, decreases intestinal glucose absorption, improves insulin sensitivity by increasing peripheral glucose uptake and utilization
patient_instructions: Take with meals to reduce GI upset
Do not crush or chew extended-release tablets
Report symptoms of lactic acidosis (muscle pain, breathing difficulty, stomach discomfort)

medications.name: Lisinopril
medications.indication: Hypertension, heart failure, post-myocardial infarction, diabetic nephropathy
medications.mechanism: Competitive inhibitor of angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE), preventing conversion of angiotensin I to angiotensin II, a potent vasoconstrictor. Reduces aldosterone secretion, decreasing sodium and water retention.
contraindications: concomitant use with aliskiren in patients with diabetes
patient_instructions: Take at same time each day
Report swelling of face/lips/tongue, difficulty breathing

medications.name: Atorvastatin
medications.indication: Hyperlipidemia, primary prevention of cardiovascular disease, secondary prevention of cardiovascular events, heterozygous familial hypercholesterolemia
medications.mechanism: Competitively inhibits HMG-CoA reductase, the rate-limiting enzyme in cholesterol synthesis. Increases hepatic LDL receptors, enhancing clearance of LDL from bloodstream.
contraindications: unexplained persistent elevations of serum transaminases
patient_instructions: Take at any time of day (with or without food)

medications.name: Omeprazole
medications.indication: GERD, erosive esophagitis, peptic ulcer disease, H. pylori eradication (in combination), Zollinger-Ellison syndrome, NSAID-induced ulcer prophylaxis
medications.mechanism: Irreversibly blocks the H+/K+-ATPase enzyme system (proton pump) in gastric parietal cells, inhibiting the final step of acid production.
medications.half_life: 0.5-1 hour (prolonged with repeated dosing due to covalent binding)
patient_instructions: Take before meals (typically 30-60 minutes before breakfast)
Do not crush or chew delayed-release formulations
Report persistent diarrhea, bone pain, muscle spasms
Consider calcium and vitamin D supplementation with long-term use

medications.name: Levothyroxine
medications.indication: Hypothyroidism, thyroid suppression therapy, myxedema coma, congenital hypothyroidism
medications.mechanism: Replaces or supplements endogenous thyroid hormone (T4), which is converted to active T3 in peripheral tissues. Regulates growth, development, and metabolic rate.
patient_instructions: Take on empty stomach 30-60 minutes before breakfast
Separate from other medications by at least 4 hours
Do not switch brands without medical supervision
Report symptoms of hyperthyroidism (palpitations, weight loss, nervousness)

medications.name: Amlodipine
medications.indication: Hypertension, chronic stable angina, vasospastic angina
medications.mechanism: Inhibits calcium ion influx across cell membranes in vascular smooth muscle and cardiac muscle, producing peripheral arterial vasodilation and reducing peripheral vascular resistance.
patient_instructions: Take at same time each day
Report significant swelling of ankles/feet, dizziness, palpitations

medications.name: Sertraline
medications.indication: Major depressive disorder, obsessive-compulsive disorder, panic disorder, post-traumatic stress disorder, social anxiety disorder, premenstrual dysphoric disorder
medications.mechanism: Selectively inhibits serotonin reuptake in the presynaptic neuron, increasing synaptic serotonin concentration and enhancing serotonergic neurotransmission.
contraindications: concomitant use with MAOIs or pimozide
black_box_warnings: Increased risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviors in children, adolescents, and young adults
monitoring_parameters: Mental status for depression, anxiety, suicidal ideation
patient_instructions: Report worsening depression, suicidal thoughts, unusual behavior changes
May take several weeks to achieve full therapeutic effect

medications.name: Albuterol
medications.indication: Bronchospasm in reversible obstructive airway disease, prevention of exercise-induced bronchospasm
medications.mechanism: Relaxes bronchial smooth muscle by action on beta-2 receptors with minimal effect on cardiac muscle contractility. Stimulates intracellular adenyl cyclase, converting ATP to cAMP, which mediates smooth muscle relaxation.
medications.excretion: Urine (76% within 72 hours, mostly as metabolites)
patient_instructions: Prime inhaler before first use or if not used for 2 weeks
Rinse mouth after use to prevent thrush
Seek medical attention if symptoms worsen or not responsive to usual dose

medications.name: Warfarin
medications.indication: Prophylaxis and treatment of venous thrombosis, pulmonary embolism, thromboembolic complications associated with atrial fibrillation, cardiac valve replacement, reduced risk of death/recurrent MI after myocardial infarction
medications.mechanism: Inhibits vitamin K-dependent synthesis of biologically active forms of clotting factors II, VII, IX, and X, as well as anticoagulant proteins C and S.
drug_interactions: Many medications including antibiotics, antifungals, antiplatelets, NSAIDs, SSRIs
Herbal supplements (garlic, ginkgo, ginseng, St. John's wort)
patient_instructions: Take at same time each day
Do not change brands without consulting physician
Report signs of bleeding (unusual bruising, blood in urine/stool, headache, dizziness)
Avoid activities with high risk of trauma

medications.name: Insulin Glargine
medications.indication: Type 1 diabetes mellitus, Type 2 diabetes mellitus
medications.mechanism: Recombinant human insulin analog with prolonged duration of action. Binds to insulin receptors, facilitating cellular glucose uptake, and regulating protein, carbohydrate, and lipid metabolism.
contraindications: hypersensitivity to insulin glargine or excipients
medications.metabolism: Liver, kidney, muscle (degraded to smaller peptides and amino acids)
drug_interactions: Many medications may affect glucose control including corticosteroids, thiazides, beta-blockers, MAOIs
patient_instructions: Administer subcutaneously once daily at same time
Do not mix with other insulins
Proper storage (refrigerate unopened, room temperature for opened vials/pens)

medications.name: Gabapentin
medications.indication: Postherpetic neuralgia, partial onset seizures, neuropathic pain, restless legs syndrome (off-label), fibromyalgia (off-label)
medications.mechanism: Binds to alpha-2-delta subunit of voltage-gated calcium channels, reducing calcium influx and subsequent release of excitatory neurotransmitters. Structural analog of GABA but does not act directly on GABA receptors.
patient_instructions: Do not abruptly discontinue (taper over at least 1 week)
Avoid alcohol and other CNS depressants
May cause dizziness/drowsiness - use caution when driving

medications.name: Hydrochlorothiazide
medications.indication: Hypertension, edema associated with heart failure, hepatic cirrhosis, renal dysfunction
medications.mechanism: Inhibits sodium reabsorption in the distal convoluted tubule, increasing excretion of sodium, water, chloride, and potassium. Produces vasodilation by unclear mechanisms.
patient_instructions: Take in morning to avoid nocturia
Take with food to reduce GI upset
Report signs of electrolyte imbalance (muscle cramps, weakness, dizziness)

medications.name: Escitalopram
medications.indication: Major depressive disorder, generalized anxiety disorder
medications.mechanism: Potent and highly selective inhibitor of serotonin reuptake. The S-enantiomer of citalopram with twice the potency of racemic citalopram.
contraindications: concomitant use with MAOIs or pimozide
black_box_warnings: Increased risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviors in children, adolescents, and young adults
monitoring_parameters: Mental status for depression, anxiety, suicidal ideation
ECG in patients with cardiac risk factors
patient_instructions: Report worsening depression, suicidal thoughts, unusual behavior changes
May take several weeks to achieve full therapeutic effect

medications.name: Losartan
medications.indication: Hypertension, diabetic nephropathy, stroke risk reduction in hypertension with LVH, heart failure (when ACE inhibitor intolerant)
medications.mechanism: Selectively blocks the binding of angiotensin II to AT1 receptors, preventing angiotensin II-induced vasoconstriction, aldosterone secretion, and sympathetic nervous system activation.
patient_instructions: Take at same time each day
Report swelling of face/lips/tongue, difficulty breathing

medications.name: Metoprolol
medications.indication: Hypertension, angina pectoris, heart failure, myocardial infarction, atrial fibrillation/flutter, migraine prophylaxis
medications.mechanism: Selectively blocks beta-1 adrenergic receptors, reducing heart rate, myocardial contractility, blood pressure, and myocardial oxygen demand.
contraindications: heart block greater than first degree
black_box_warnings: Do not abruptly withdraw (may exacerbate angina, MI)
patient_instructions: Take with or immediately after meals
Do not crush or chew extended-release tablets
Report shortness of breath, weight gain, edema
Use caution when driving or operating machinery

medications.name: Duloxetine
medications.indication: Major depressive disorder, generalized anxiety disorder, diabetic peripheral neuropathic pain, fibromyalgia, chronic musculoskeletal pain
medications.mechanism: Potent inhibitor of serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake, and a weaker inhibitor of dopamine reuptake. Enhances serotonergic and noradrenergic activity in the CNS.
black_box_warnings: Increased risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviors in children, adolescents, and young adults
monitoring_parameters: Mental status for depression, anxiety, suicidal ideation
patient_instructions: Swallow whole - do not crush, chew, or open capsule
Report worsening depression, suicidal thoughts, unusual behavior changes
May take several weeks to achieve full therapeutic effect

medications.name: Pantoprazole
medications.indication: GERD, erosive esophagitis, pathological hypersecretory conditions including Zollinger-Ellison syndrome, H. pylori eradication (in combination)
medications.mechanism: Irreversibly binds to H+/K+-ATPase enzyme system at secretory surface of gastric parietal cells, inhibiting the final step of acid production.
contraindications: hypersensitivity to pantoprazole or substituted benzimidazoles
drug_interactions: Drugs requiring gastric acid for absorption (e.g., ketoconazole, iron salts)
patient_instructions: Swallow tablet whole - do not crush or chew
Report persistent diarrhea, bone pain, muscle spasms
Consider calcium and vitamin D supplementation with long-term use

medications.name: Tramadol
medications.indication: Moderate to moderately severe pain
medications.mechanism: Binds to mu-opioid receptors and weakly inhibits reuptake of serotonin and norepinephrine. The O-desmethyl metabolite has higher affinity for mu-opioid receptors.
contraindications: concomitant use with MAOIs or serotonin precursors
patient_instructions: Do not crush or chew extended-release formulations
May cause dependence with long-term use
Do not stop abruptly after long-term use

medications.name: Venlafaxine
medications.indication: Major depressive disorder, generalized anxiety disorder, social anxiety disorder, panic disorder
medications.mechanism: Inhibits serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake, and weakly inhibits dopamine reuptake. The O-desmethyl metabolite is also pharmacologically active.
black_box_warnings: Increased risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviors in children, adolescents, and young adults
monitoring_parameters: Mental status for depression, anxiety, suicidal ideation
patient_instructions: Report worsening depression, suicidal thoughts, unusual behavior changes
May take several weeks to achieve full therapeutic effect

medications.name: Fluoxetine
medications.indication: Major depressive disorder, obsessive-compulsive disorder, bulimia nervosa, panic disorder, premenstrual dysphoric disorder
medications.mechanism: Selectively inhibits serotonin reuptake in the presynaptic neuron, increasing synaptic concentration of serotonin. Has a long half-life due to active metabolite norfluoxetine.
contraindications: concomitant use with MAOIs or thioridazine
black_box_warnings: Increased risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviors in children, adolescents, and young adults
medications.half_life: 4-6 days (after chronic administration), 4-16 days for norfluoxetine
monitoring_parameters: Mental status for depression, anxiety, suicidal ideation
patient_instructions: Take in morning to minimize insomnia
May take with food to reduce GI upset
Report worsening depression, suicidal thoughts, unusual behavior changes
Allow several weeks for full therapeutic effect

medications.name: Furosemide
medications.indication: Edema associated with heart failure, hepatic cirrhosis, renal disease, hypertension
medications.mechanism: Inhibits sodium and chloride reabsorption in the ascending loop of Henle and distal renal tubule, increasing excretion of water, sodium, chloride, magnesium, calcium, and potassium.
patient_instructions: Take in morning to avoid nocturia
Take with food to reduce GI upset
Report signs of electrolyte imbalance (muscle cramps, weakness, dizziness)

medications.name: Montelukast
medications.indication: Asthma prophylaxis and chronic treatment, exercise-induced bronchoconstriction, allergic rhinitis
medications.mechanism: Selectively blocks leukotriene D4 (LTD4) at cysteinyl leukotriene receptors, inhibiting airway edema, smooth muscle contraction, and inflammatory cell activity.
patient_instructions: Report behavior or mood changes, agitation, depression, suicidal thoughts
Continue other asthma medications unless directed otherwise
May take with or without food

medications.name: Quetiapine
medications.indication: Schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, major depressive disorder (adjunct)
medications.mechanism: Antagonizes dopamine type 2 (D2) and serotonin type 2 (5-HT2) receptors. Also has antagonist activity at histamine H1, adrenergic Î±1, and serotonin 5-HT1A receptors.
black_box_warnings: Increased mortality in elderly patients with dementia-related psychosis
Suicidal thoughts and behaviors in children, adolescents, and young adults
patient_instructions: Take without food or with light meal

medications.name: Rosuvastatin
medications.indication: Hyperlipidemia, primary prevention of cardiovascular disease, slowing atherosclerosis progression
medications.mechanism: Competitively inhibits HMG-CoA reductase, the rate-limiting enzyme in cholesterol synthesis. Increases hepatic LDL receptors, enhancing clearance of LDL from bloodstream.
contraindications: unexplained persistent elevations of serum transaminases

medications.name: Tamsulosin
medications.indication: Benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH)
medications.mechanism: Selectively blocks alpha-1A adrenergic receptors in the prostate and bladder neck, relaxing smooth muscle and improving urine flow and BPH symptoms.
patient_instructions: Take 30 minutes after same meal each day
Do not crush, chew, or open capsules
Inform ophthalmologist about tamsulosin use before cataract surgery

medications.name: Clopidogrel
medications.indication: Acute coronary syndrome, recent MI, recent stroke, peripheral arterial disease
medications.mechanism: Selectively inhibits ADP binding to P2Y12 receptor on platelets, preventing ADP-mediated activation of GPIIb/IIIa complex and platelet aggregation.
black_box_warnings: Diminished effectiveness in CYP2C19 poor metabolizers
medications.metabolism: Hepatic (CYP2C19, CYP3A4, CYP2B6, CYP1A2) to active metabolite
patient_instructions: Do not stop without consulting doctor
Inform dentists/doctors about clopidogrel use before procedures
Avoid activities with high risk of bleeding

medications.name: Bupropion
medications.indication: Major depressive disorder, seasonal affective disorder, smoking cessation
medications.mechanism: Weakly inhibits norepinephrine and dopamine reuptake. Does not inhibit MAO or serotonin reuptake. Mechanism for smoking cessation is unknown.
contraindications: current/prior diagnosis of bulimia or anorexia nervosa
black_box_warnings: Increased risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviors in children, adolescents, and young adults
monitoring_parameters: Mental status for depression, suicidal ideation
patient_instructions: Do not crush or chew extended-release tablets
May cause insomnia - take morning dose early

medications.name: Diazepam
medications.indication: Anxiety disorders, alcohol withdrawal, skeletal muscle spasm, seizure disorders, preoperative sedation
medications.mechanism: Enhances GABA effects by binding to benzodiazepine receptors on GABA-A receptor complex, increasing neuronal membrane permeability to chloride ions resulting in hyperpolarization and reduced neuronal excitability.
patient_instructions: Do not drive or operate machinery

medications.name: Esomeprazole
medications.indication: GERD, erosive esophagitis, H. pylori eradication, pathological hypersecretory conditions, NSAID-induced ulcer risk reduction
medications.mechanism: The S-isomer of omeprazole. Irreversibly binds to H+/K+-ATPase enzyme system at secretory surface of gastric parietal cells, inhibiting the final step of acid production.
contraindications: hypersensitivity to esomeprazole or substituted benzimidazoles
drug_interactions: Drugs requiring gastric acid for absorption
patient_instructions: Take at least 1 hour before meals
Report persistent diarrhea, bone pain, muscle spasms
Consider calcium and vitamin D supplementation with long-term use

medications.name: Glipizide
medications.indication: Type 2 diabetes mellitus
medications.mechanism: Stimulates insulin release from pancreatic beta cells, reduces glucose output from liver, increases insulin sensitivity at peripheral target sites.
patient_instructions: Do not crush or chew extended-release tablets

medications.name: Ibuprofen
medications.indication: Mild to moderate pain, inflammation, fever, dysmenorrhea, rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis
medications.mechanism: Inhibits cyclooxygenase (COX-1 and COX-2) enzymes, reducing prostaglandin synthesis, which mediates pain, inflammation, and fever.
contraindications: perioperative coronary artery bypass graft pain
black_box_warnings: Increased risk of serious cardiovascular thrombotic events
Increased risk of serious GI adverse events
medications.pregnancy_category: C (first and second trimester), D (third trimester)
patient_instructions: Take with food or milk to reduce GI upset
Report signs of GI bleeding (black stools, abdominal pain)
Use lowest effective dose for shortest duration

medications.name: Lorazepam
medications.indication: Anxiety disorders, anxiety-associated insomnia, status epilepticus, preoperative sedation, chemotherapy-induced nausea/vomiting
medications.mechanism: Enhances GABA effects by binding to benzodiazepine receptors on GABA-A receptor complex, increasing neuronal membrane permeability to chloride ions resulting in hyperpolarization and reduced neuronal excitability.
patient_instructions: Do not drive or operate machinery

medications.name: Meloxicam
medications.indication: Osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, juvenile rheumatoid arthritis
medications.mechanism: Inhibits cyclooxygenase (COX-2 greater than COX-1), reducing prostaglandin synthesis, which mediates pain and inflammation.
contraindications: perioperative coronary artery bypass graft pain
black_box_warnings: Increased risk of serious cardiovascular thrombotic events
Increased risk of serious GI adverse events
medications.pregnancy_category: C (first and second trimester), D (third trimester)
patient_instructions: Take with food or milk to reduce GI upset
Report signs of GI bleeding (black stools, abdominal pain)
Use lowest effective dose for shortest duration
